definitions.text:
z. [Latin rasus, rado.]
1. To pass along the surface of thing, with striking or rubbing it at the same time; to graze. Might not the bullet which rased his cheek, have gone into his head? obsolete
2. To erase; to scratch or rub out; or to blot out; to cancel.[In this sense, erase is generally used.]
3. To level with the ground; to overthrow; to destroy; as, to rase city.[In this sense, raze is generally used. This orthography, rase may therefore be considered nearly obsolete; graze, erase and raze having superseded it.] n
1. cancel; erasure. [Not in use.]
2. slight wound. [Not in use.]
